TopicTitle: Squadcast Summary for 2015-04-18 - Picture Perfect Edition!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Nope, I was more thinking 'low profile cargo bay to shove lots of little bits in' ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) I thought US was all about the wedge attachments tho?

 I think he meant [6S Service Compartment](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-25-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth!) Mod, not Universal Storage. You have to admit they do look similar, but you know great minds think alike.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T01:56:55Z" title="04/18/2015 01:56  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by Alshain**

Glad the Round8 is staying. I was going to mod it in, so I wasn't complaining.

But that tank is aesthetically and structurally unique, i use it a lot, i dont use xenon almost ever, so... Good move!

And, wow, can't wait for this patch. So many nice additions and changes keep popping up.

> 
> I think he meant [6S Service Compartment](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-25-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth!) Mod, not Universal Storage. You have to admit they do look similar, but you know great minds think alike.

I did mean to say Universial Storage, but yes it's more similar to the 6S service compartment mod.

Also, Roverdude, is there a storage part without the central pillar in it?

> 
> I hope not!
> Its such a drag to have so much drag, especially when its so high that you can more or enter kerbin's atmosphere at 100km/s, aiming right at its middle, and slow down to less then 200m/s before impact. This is a joke. At least the reentry (or so i hope) will be plausible but not too limiting when it comes to aerobraking on SSTOs.

Why would you hope not to have configurable settings?

And when i say souposphere i mean Infiniglide and stupid designs that can fly. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Why would you hope not to have configurable settings?
> And when i say souposphere i mean Infiniglide and stupid designs that can fly. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I doubt that infinigliders will still work, because the calculations and modeling of drag, lift and control surfaces will be different. Changing the atmospheric density won't matter.

> 
> I think he meant [6S Service Compartment](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-25-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth!) Mod, not Universal Storage. You have to admit they do look similar, but you know great minds think alike.

Yeah, I already have a very aggressive 'fan' accusing me of plagirism ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) It's been a fun night.
Wow. Just wow. I am impressed and very hyped about this!! Keep up the excellent work Squad!

I hope the heatsheilds will be multi use.

If not... I will slowly descend.

> 
> Radial drogue chute?

Yes, that would appear to be the case. I get the feeling that we'll be using these a lot more often with the new aero. Also, stock mk3 plane?

> 
> I hope the heatsheilds will be multi use.
> If not... I will slowly descend.

Im ready for those heat shields. I already have plans for a giant array of them to spearhead my interplanetary giant...

> 
> I hope the heatsheilds will be multi use.
> If not... I will slowly descend.

He said they very likely wont be. They're ablative, which means that heat chips away at them as you reenter, so they'll be destroyed on reentry.

Looks like I will have to continue what I do now, retroburn before reentry, but it will have to be a shallow entry.

And my ion crafts I made switch to the tordial tanks will be rebuilt.
Long Live the ROUND-8 \:P/

> 
> Looks like I will have to continue what I do now, retroburn before reentry, but it will have to be a shallow entry.
> And my ion crafts I made switch to the tordial tanks will be rebuilt.

I'm not quite understanding. Even if they have limited heat protection. They could still be useful.
It really looks like Squad is going to knock 1.0 out of the park. I'm giddy over here.
I just realized - One can always turn a large utility bay on its side, put a Kerbal in it (and close it), and create **a hamster wheel sort of mobile!**

> 
> I'm not quite understanding. Even if they have limited heat protection. They could still be useful.

Useful yes, reusable no.

I was planning on making a base on duna, eve, laythe, mun, and minmus, and having reusable and modular rockets to go between bases (fully reusable, like just refuel).

> 
> Useful yes, reusable no.
> I was planning on making a base on duna, eve, laythe, mun, and minmus, and having reusable and modular rockets to go between bases (fully reusable, like just refuel).

You could have a detachable heatshield system, using docking ports. All you have to do is make sure that all your resupply ships bring heatshields.
Hopefully they have an abalation(?) gauge so we can see how much more they can take between uses. I hope to aerobreak at jool, then re-aero break back at kerbin to resupply and replace them then.

No thanks, my retroburn way is good enough for me. I want it to be self sufficent, no need to launch anything from kerbin after all modules are there.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T04:01:12Z" title="04/18/2015 04:01  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by LABHOUSE**

> 
> Hopefully they have an abalation(?) gauge so we can see how much more they can take between uses. I hope to aerobreak at jool, then re-aero break back at kerbin to resupply and replace them then.

I wonder how well they'll stack on top of each other, and if that'll offer a solution for multiple aerobrakes.
Just want to add my disapproval of the fairing separation style. It makes no sense for them to come apart on the horizontal axis.

> 
> Just want to add my disapproval of the fairing separation style. It makes no sense for them to come apart on the horizontal axis.

take my sig bud

Craft thumbnails?

What happens if you have a huge rocket? Would it break if Whackjob loads it?
love you work sir. Really looking forward to this update!
